fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: A chart accompanying an article headed Record year for A grades that highlights north-south divide (page 12, August 15) underrated the Welsh. It showed a 19.8% pass rate in 2008; that figure should have been 24.1%. The changes shown between levels attained in 2002 and those of 2008 were increases in percentage points, not percentage increases. In a report from Georgia (page 4, some editions, August 14) we misquoted Anna Neistat of Human Rights Watch. Our report should have said that 273 people had been treated at Tskhinvali hospital during the conflict and that 44 dead people had been brought to the hospital - not, as we quoted her as saying, to the morgue. A picture purporting to show Apple's corporate headquarters in Cupertino (Google pipped - Apple the new king of Silicon Valley as market value overtakes hi-tech rival, page 3, August 15) in fact showed Symantec's headquarters nearby. Elise, not Elsie, Laverick won bronze in the double sculls at the Olympics with Anna Bebington (Medal after medal after medal after medal ... page 1, Sport, August 18); and she was the one on the right in our picture, not the one on the left. The word anorexia is derived from the Greek orexis - not as we said, rexia - meaning desire or longing, and the prefix an-, denoting a lack of it (The rise of the 'rexics': another illness we made up earlier, page 2, G2, August 18).
